title: ISic003547. An antiquarian 'forgery'
body:
Facsimile Images

1ΟΣΟΙΣΑΓΝΑΙΣ
2ΠΟΛΙΟΥΧΟΙΣ[··]
3ΟΔΑΜΟΣΚΑΤΙΦΗΣ
4ΔΡΕΠΑΝ[....?]
5ΕΥΕΡΓΕΣΙΟΣΕΝΕΚΕΝ

1: orig.

Apparatus criticus

Text after comparison of Kaibel, Filippi and SEG, prioritising Kaibel's transcription of the manuscript tradition

translation

commentary

As Korhonen lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV. Korhonen 2017: 199 notes that κατιφης for κατηφής appears to be derived from another forgery, of Cesare Gaetani (IG XIV.5*), which uses the same orthographic variant, and is otherwise a purely literary term.

bibliography

  • 14.0023* https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 52.0892 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Filippi 2002 73 no.8/2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001991
  • Filippi 2005 66 no. 8/2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002296
  • Korhonen 2017 198-199 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001484
